alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 12 at 5:23PM MST until August 12 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northeastern La Paz County in west central Arizona... North central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 630 PM MST. * At 523 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 13 miles north of Wenden to Salome to 17 miles southeast of Harcuvar, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 29 and 69. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 67. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 22 and 49. Locations impacted include... Salome, Brenda, Vicksburg Junction, Wenden, Vicksburg, Bouse and Harcuvar. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
